intro: Cleistanthus kasaiensis var. paulopubescens, commonly known as the Kasai cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and deciduous leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
